tools.name: create_invoice
tools.description:
Create Invoices on PayPal.

This function is used to create an invoice in the PayPal system. It allows you to generate a new invoice, specifying details such as customer information, items, quantities, pricing, and tax information. Once created, an invoice can be sent to the customer for payment.

invoice_date.description: The invoice date in YYYY-MM-DD format

detail.description: The invoice detail, like{ "invoice_number": "#123", "reference": "deal-ref", "invoice_date": "2018-11-12", "currency_code": "USD", "note": "Thank you for your business.", "term": "No refunds after 30 days.", "memo": "This is a long contract", "payment_term": { "term_type": "NET_10", "due_date": "2018-11-22" } }

invoicer.description: The invoicer business information that appears on the invoice.

billing_info.description: The billing information of the invoice recipient

quantity.description: The quantity of the item that the invoicer provides to the payer. Value is from -1000000 to 1000000. Supports up to five decimal places. Cast to string

currency_code.description: Currency code of the unit amount

value.description: The unit price. Up to 2 decimal points

unit_of_measure.description: The unit of measure for the invoiced item

tools.name: create_product
tools.description:
Create a product in PayPal using product catalog - create products API.
This function creates a new product that will be used in subscription plans, subscriptions.
Required parameters are: name (product name), type (product type).
High level: 
    - id: (auto-generated or specify SKU of the product) The ID of the product
    - name: {product_name} (required) 
    - description: {product_description} (optional)
    - type {DIGITAL | PHYSICAL | SERVICE} (required)
    - category: {product_category} (optional) 
    - image_url: {image_url} (optional)
    - home_url: {home_url} (optional)

Below is the payload request structure:
{
    "id": "#PROD-XYAB12ABSB7868434",
    "name": "Video Streaming Service",
    "description": "Service for streaming latest series, movies etc.",
    "type": "SERVICE",
    "category": "SOFTWARE",
    "image_url": "https://example.com/streaming.jpg",
    "home_url": "https://example.com/home"
}

type.description: The product type. Value is PHYSICAL, DIGITAL, or SERVICE.

image_url.description: The image URL for the product.

home_url.description: The home page URL for the product.

tools.name: create_subscription_plan
tools.description:
Create a subsctiption plan in PayPal using subscription - create plan API.
This function creates a new subscription plan that defines pricing and billing cycle details for subscriptions.
Required parameters are: product_id (the ID of the product for which to create the plan), name (subscription plan name), billing_cycles (billing cycle details).
High level: product_id, name, description, taxes, status: {CREATED|INACTIVE|ACTIVE}, billing_cycles, payment_preferences are required in json object.
While creating billing_cycles object, trial(second) billing cycle should precede regular billing cycle.

product_id.description: The ID of the product for which to create the plan.

interval_unit.description: The unit of time for the billing cycle.

interval_count.description: The number of units for the billing cycle.

frequency.description: The frequency of the billing cycle.

tenure_type.description: The type of billing cycle tenure.

sequence.description: The sequence of the billing cycle.

total_cycles.description: The total number of cycles in the billing plan.

currency_code.description: The currency code for the fixed price.

value.description: The value of the fixed price.

fixed_price.description: The fixed price for the subscription plan.

version.description: The version of the pricing scheme.

pricing_scheme.description: The pricing scheme for the billing cycle.

billing_cycles.description: The billing cycles of the plan.

auto_bill_outstanding.description: Indicates whether to automatically bill outstanding amounts.

currency_code.description: The currency code for the setup fee.

value.description: The value of the setup fee.

setup_fee.description: The setup fee for the subscription plan.

setup_fee_failure_action.description: The action to take if the setup fee payment fails.

payment_failure_threshold.description: The number of failed payments before the subscription is canceled.

payment_preferences.description: The payment preferences for the subscription plan.

inclusive.description: Indicates whether the tax is inclusive.

tools.name: create_shipment_tracking
tools.description:
Create a shipment for a transaction in PayPal.
This function creates a shipment record for a specific transaction, allowing you to track the shipment status and details.
The transaction_id can fetch from the captured payment details in the order information.
Required parameters are: tracking_number (the tracking number for the shipment), transaction_id (the transaction ID associated with the shipment). 
High level: tracking_number, transaction_id, status (optional), carrier (optional) are required json objects.
Below is the payload request structure:
{
    "tracking_number": "1234567890",
    "transaction_id": "9XJ12345ABC67890",
    "status": "SHIPPED", // Required: ON_HOLD, SHIPPED, DELIVERED, CANCELLED
    "carrier": "UPS" // Required: The carrier handling the shipment. Link to supported carriers: http://developer.paypal.com/docs/tracking/reference/carriers/
}

order_id.description: The ID of the order for which to create a shipment

tracking_number.description: The tracking number for the shipment. Id is provided by the shipper. This is required to create a shipment.

transaction_id.description: The transaction ID associated with the shipment. Transaction id available after the order is paid or captured. This is required to create a shipment.

status.description: The status of the shipment. It can be "ON_HOLD", "SHIPPED", "DELIVERED", or "CANCELLED".

tools.name: create_order
tools.description:
Create an order in PayPal.

This tool is used to create a new order in PayPal. This is typically the first step in initiating a payment flow. It sets up an order with specified details such as item(s) to be purchased, quantity, amount, currency, and other details.

quantity.description: The item quantity. Must be a whole number.

itemCost.description: The cost of each item - upto 2 decimal points.

taxPercent.description: The tax percent for the specific item.

itemTotal.description: The total cost of this line item.

discount.description: The discount amount for the order.

shippingCost.description: The cost of shipping for the order.

address_line_1.description: The first line of the address, such as number and street, for example, `173 Drury Lane`.This field needs to pass the full address.

address_line_2.description: The second line of the address, for example, a suite or apartment number.

admin_area_2.description: A city, town, or village. Smaller than `admin_area_level_1`.

admin_area_1.description: The highest-level sub-division in a country, which is usually a province, state, or ISO-3166-2 subdivision.

postal_code.description: The postal code, which is the ZIP code or equivalent. Typically required for countries with a postal code or an equivalent.

country_code.description: The 2-character ISO 3166-1 code that identifies the country or region. Note: The country code for Great Britain is `GB` and not `UK` as used in the top-level domain names for that country.

anyOf.description: The shipping address for the order.

shippingAddress.description: The shipping address for the order.

tools.name: create_refund
tools.description:
Initiate a refund for a PayPal payment capture.
If you have an order ID instead of a capture ID, first use the get order tool to obtain the capture ID from the order details.
This function allows you to return funds to a customer by refunding a previously captured payment. You can issue a full refund or specify a partial amount. If multiple captures exist for an order, request clarification on which specific capture to refund.
Required parameters:
- Capture ID: The ID of the capture to refund
- Amount (optional): For partial refunds, specify the amount to refund (must be less than or equal to the captured amount)
- Note to Payer (optional): Additional explanation visible to the customer
Response details include:
- Refund ID and status
- Refunded amount and currency

capture_id.description: The ID of the capture to refund.

amount.description: The amount to refund. If not specified, the full captured amount is refunded.

invoice_id.description: The invoice ID that is used to track this payment.

query: Create an invoice for Tech Solutions Inc. for a Consultation Service costing 150.00 USD.
